duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop and maintain productive working relationships with project sponsors, stakeholders and key business users.
Prepare cost estimates for staff resourcing, vendors, consultants, hardware, and services.
Prepare the project plan, project scope, procurement plan, and schedules.
Manage issues, risks, change controls, and status reporting.
Plan team member work assignments and schedules, and guide and monitor work performance.
Communicate project status regularly to IT management and project stakeholders.

education_certification.credential: BS or BA degree in computer science, business administration, or related technical field or equivalent experience is required.
Minimum 5 years in project management in large enterprise environments overseeing small to large teams directly and in matrix managed environments.

Excellent written and verbal communication, presentation, and organizational skills, and the ability to build strong working relationships with technical and non-technical teams alike, at all levels (including senior management).
